Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= a young male lion (אֲרִי) ≈ regarded as fierce and dangerous

Node.gloss: to be confident|to be unsuspecting|to be secure
Node.definition: = state in which humans live with confidence and without fear; ≈ often regarded as carelessness, especially when there is no mention of trust in YHWH
= action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency
= someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

Node.gloss: to be intelligent|to be discerning|to have insight|to be an expert
Node.definition: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
literally: to know; hence: = state in which humans are endowed with knowledge, often through experience

Node.gloss: to prolong (days) > to stay long|to linger|to last|to live on
Node.definition: literally: to prolong (days); hence: = to stay (in a certain location or position) for an extended period of time
primarily found in poetic contexts: = human being; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality
= state of being needy as a result of one's lack of monetary or physical resources, usually resulting in a lower social status with little authority or power and at the risk of being exploited
= a person or class of people that lack the means to support themselves; ≈ thereby often despised or mistreated, but being under God's protection
= water coming down from the sky, which is indispensable for sustaining human life, but can be both refreshing and destructive

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general
= action by which humans or deities suspend their commitment to a certain pattern of behavior
= causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior
= action by which humans or divine beings express their appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude to (other) humans or deities about who they are and what they do
= action by which humans or deities act in accordance with a certain (usually) prescribed pattern of behavior, such as a law, covenant, etc.
= causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior
= causative action by which humans provoke other humans to anger and so cause conflicts
= condition of a human or a spirit that is not considered morally good or pure or right; can refer to an individual, a group, or a nation

Node.gloss: to consider|to pay heed|to perceive|to realize|to understand|to distinguish
Node.definition: = process by which someone gains knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= practices that conform to the laws of God
= action where humans make an intensive effort to associate with a deity, to serve and worship him, and to get answers to questions
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to consider|to pay heed|to perceive|to realize|to understand|to distinguish
Node.definition: = process by which someone gains knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= state of being needy as a result of one's lack of monetary or physical resources, usually resulting in a lower social status with little authority or power and at the risk of being exploited
= process by which humans or deities follow a certain pattern of behavior, ◄ which is described as their journey through life
literally: to be crooked (of an event); hence: = state in which an event is considered morally and/or ethically unacceptable
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= action by which humans or deities act in accordance with a certain (usually) prescribed pattern of behavior, such as a law, covenant, etc.
= causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

Node.gloss: to be intelligent|to be discerning|to have insight|to be an expert
Node.definition: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance
= state in which humans have the habit of ingesting more food than enough or appropriate; ≈ regarded as despicable and shameful behavior
= causative action by which humans cause other humans to experience a feeling of shame
= direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort
= a large quantity of valuable resources, ownership of which affects the way people think and live
= the amount of money a person is required to pay for having borrowed money, food, or something of value
= the amount of money a person pays to a lender at a particular rate for the use of money that has been borrowed

Node.gloss: to be kindly disposed|to be generous|to be merciful|to be gracious|to pity
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities are favorably disposed to (other) humans, and act accordingly
= a person or class of people that lack the means to support themselves; ≈ thereby often despised or mistreated, but being under God's protection
= causative action by which humans gather inanimate objects from different sources to keep for oneself or store it
= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry
= causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= action by which humans speak to a deity, often by raising their hands, ► requesting help or expressing their thankfulness
= state in which an event is considered utterly wrong and detestable
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to act wrongly
= person whose behavior is morally and ethically right
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control
= action by which humans or deities take permanent possession of objects, humans, or property, either by inheritance or force
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= a person or class of people that lack the means to support themselves; ≈ thereby often despised or mistreated, but being under God's protection

Node.gloss: to be intelligent|to be discerning|to have insight|to be an expert
Node.definition: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

Node.gloss: to look for|to try out|to test|to search out|to explore|to investigate|to examine|to cross examine|to sound out|to determine
Node.definition: = action by which someone tries to obtain information about a certain object, person, or event by examining it carefully
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= process by which an event happens with great strength or intensity
literally: to be searched; hence: = action by which humans move to a location where they will not be readily seen
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
literally: to cover (information); hence: = causative action by which humans or deities keep certain information hidden from others
= action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression
= action by which humans complete a task with the expected or desired outcome
= action by which humans publicly admit their own shortcomings before God, or the shortcomings of the people they represent
= action by which humans or deities suspend their commitment to a certain pattern of behavior

Node.gloss: to find mercy|to receive mercy|to obtain mercy
Node.definition: = process by which humans are treated with compassion by others, ► and so be forgiven, spared and/or avoid punishment
= state of being considered fortunate and blessed by God; ≈ accompanied by an attitude of admiration
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

Node.gloss: to be stubborn|to be stiff necked
Node.definition: literally: to harden one's neck, heart; = action by which humans show themselves to be stubborn and unwilling to yield
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
literally: to fall; hence: = process by which humans become suddenly involved in a certain difficult situation
= state of hardship or difficulty in a circumstance, sometimes as the consequence of wicked behavior

= the largest of the great cats, often being about 2.8 meters from nose to tip of tail, standing as high as 1 meter (3 feet 3 inches) at the shoulder; pale yellowish brown in color; around the neck and shoulders of adult males grows a mane that is darker than the rest of their fur; ◄ Panthera leo; ► unclean animal; ≈ associated with aggression and strength
= action by which an animal makes a deep inarticulate sound; ≈ usually regarded as menacing

= large mammal with thick fur and a rather doglike face; walks on all fours but may stand up on its back legs to get a better view; maybe 2 meters tall when standing up and weigh over 200 kilos; feeds on roots, berries, wild fruit, mice, and lizards, and, occasionally, small livestock; ◄ |iUrsus arctos syriacus|i*; ► dangerous when provoked or robbed of cubs; ≈ associated with violence and danger
= process by which animals move forward at great speed and with aggressive intent
= a person or class of people that lack the means to support themselves; ≈ thereby often despised or mistreated, but being under God's protection
= a person in a position of high authority over a nation, a division of priests or levites, or an army
= state in which humans lack a particular quality that they are supposed to have
= state whereby someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= process by which an event happens with great strength or intensity
= state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice
= possessions accumulated through advantageous transactions, in which part of the income can be kept for oneself, mostly achieved in an unjust way

Node.gloss: to prolong (days) > to stay long|to linger|to last|to live on
Node.definition: literally: to prolong (days); hence: = to stay (in a certain location or position) for an extended period of time
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= causative action by which humans kill other humans in a violent way, usually involving the shedding of blood, which brings guilt upon the people committing these acts
= the dead body of a human being, ◄ as defined by the life principle that used to animate it; ≈ contact with it causes ritual uncleanness
particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y
= world of the dead, ◄ described as a pit, deep in the ground
= process by which humans or deities follow a certain pattern of behavior, ◄ which is described as their journey through life
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts
literally: to be crooked of ways; hence: = state in which humans are morally and/or ethically unacceptable as far as their behavior is concerned
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
literally: to fall; hence: = process by which an individual or nation loses power, prosperity or status
= state in which a countable entity is one in number

Node.gloss: to work|to till|to plow (soil, flax)|to dress (a vineyard)
Node.definition: literally, to serve; therefore = action by which workers prepare land of planting and harvesting; also refers to caring for a vineyard, processing linen, or using cattle for working the land

= the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again
= process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

Node.gloss: to be satisfied (with something)|to have one's fill (of something)
Node.definition: literally: to be satiated (with an event); hence: = process by which humans become more than fully engaged in a certain process or activity, which can be either good or bad
= state in which humans lack sufficient means to live at a standard that is considered normal; ≈ sometimes associated with laziness or foolishness, but ultimately determined by God
= state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their actions
= process by which an event happens with great strength or intensity
= action by which deities grant a special favor to humans, objects, and events, or by which humans invoke a deity to do the same
= state in which humans feel pressed to act quickly; ≈ often associated with a lack of wisdom

Node.gloss: to be free|to be innocent|to go unpunished
Node.definition: = state or process in which humans are not held responsible for actions committed in the past or for future commitments
= action with which humans favor one side in a dispute over the other
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= a relatively small quantity of food
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general
= action by which a person or group challenges or defies an authority or agreement
primarily found in poetic contexts: = human being; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

Node.gloss: to be quick|to be hasty|to be rash|sudden
Node.definition: = action by which humans or divine beings act quickly
= a large quantity of valuable resources, ownership of which affects the way people think and live
= condition of a human or a spirit that is not considered morally good or pure or right; can refer to an individual, a group, or a nation

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= state in which humans are in lack of something that they are supposed to have; ≈ associated with hardship
= action by which humans or deities express their disapproval of something with words
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= referent to the time after the event in focus
= state in which humans have a positive and compassionate attitude towards other humans
literally: to find favor; hence: = state in which humans find the approval of deities or (other) humans

Node.gloss: to cause to flatter|to make deceitful
Node.definition: literally: to make smooth; hence: = causative action by which humans cause events to appear well intentioned, though actually being insincere
= the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking
= action by which humans take property unlawfully from a person or place, usually by force or threat of force
= direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort
= direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression
= person that belongs to a group or class of people
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= causative action by which humans provoke other humans to anger and so cause conflicts
= state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons
= state in which humans have confidence in someone or something else and show that by their actions; ≈ usually regarded as negative when the object is human, always positive when the object is YHWH
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to be made fat > to prosper
Node.definition: = process by which humans are caused to prosper in life, described as becoming fat
= state in which humans have confidence in someone or something else and show that by their actions; ≈ usually regarded as negative when the object is human, always positive when the object is YHWH
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

= state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's heart (לֵב) the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals
= process by which humans or deities follow a certain pattern of behavior, ◄ which is described as their journey through life
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= state of being needy as a result of one's lack of monetary or physical resources, usually resulting in a lower social status with little authority or power and at the risk of being exploited

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= process by which an event happens with great strength or intensity

= act by which humans consign other humans or objects to death, damage, or destruction, usually by invoking the name of a deity if the agent is human; ◄ this is done as punishment, out of contempt, anger, or hostility, or because one was paid to do so; ► the effectiveness of a curse partially depends on the authority of the one pronouncing it
= action by which humans go to a location where they will not be readily seen or where danger cannot reach them
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

Node.gloss: to vanish|to disappear|to be lost|to perish|to be broken|to be destroyed|to be ruined
Node.definition: = process by which humans or objects disappear or are removed from existence;◄ either by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, natural processes, acts of destruction, or direct divine intervention
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
